Generation IV.Diamond: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.
Generation IV.Pearl: Its body is encased in a sturdy shell. Its head rotates 180 degrees, eliminating blind spots.
Generation IV.Platinum: Possessing a sturdy build, it takes pride in its strength, taking down foes without using toxins.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It attacks people and Pokémon that cross the desert. This has only furthered its bad reputation.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It attacks people and Pokémon that cross the desert. This has only furthered its bad reputation.

Generation VIII.Sword: Its poison is potent, but it rarely sees use. This Pokémon prefers to use physical force instead, going on rampages with its car-crushing strength.
Generation VIII.Shield: It's so vicious that it's called the Sand Demon. Yet when confronted by Hippowdon , Drapion keeps a low profile and will never pick a fight.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its body is encased in a sturdy shell. Its head rotates 180 degrees, eliminating blind spots.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Has a brutish, ferocious temperament. With immense strength and a sturdy shell off which swords will bounce, it rampages about and wreaks havoc.
